subject: Cybersecurity
title: Mary Queen of Scots: Encryption That Failed
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mary Queen of Scots: Encryption That Failed usable.

hook.text: A queen lost her head because her cipher was cracked by Elizabeth I's spymaster.

buildup.text: Mary used a substitution cipher to plot against Elizabeth. She thought her letters were unbreakable.

discovery.text: Spymaster Francis Walsingham's codebreaker Thomas Phelippes cracked her cipher using frequency analysis.

twist.text: Walsingham let the plot continue, adding a forged postscript to Mary's letter to identify all the conspirators.

climax.text: Mary was executed in 1587. Her trust in a weak cipher cost her everything.

punchline.text: Bad encryption cost a queen her head.

quiz.question: How was Mary Queen of Scots' cipher broken?
options: The key was found in her belongings
